title: SQLINSERT INTO Keyword

metadata.description: Learn about SQLINSERT INTO Keyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Reference

❯
INSERT INTO
The
INSERT INTO
command is used to insert new rows in a table.
The following SQL inserts a new record in the "Customers" table:
Example
INSERT INTO Customers (CustomerName, ContactName, Address, City, PostalCode, Country)
VALUES ('Cardinal', 'Tom B. Erichsen', 'Skagen 21', 'Stavanger', '4006', 'Norway');
The following SQL will insert a new record, but only insert data in the "CustomerName", 
"City", and "Country" columns (CustomerID will 
be updated automatically):
Example
INSERT INTO Customers (CustomerName, City, Country)
VALUES ('Cardinal', 'Stavanger', 'Norway');

Reference

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers SQLINSERT INTO Keyword concepts and techniques. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQLINSERT INTO Keyword and how to apply it in your projects.
